Text.name: Text0
Text.content:
Template JSPs are never called directly in a request chain. The entry point of an OpenCms request points to a so called container page. Say, a website user requests a page like https://example.com/index.html or https://example.com/foo/bar/index.html, then the resource type behind each index.html file is a container page.

Whilst template JSPs are saved in modules under the /system/modules/ directory of the virtual file system, container pages are stored below the /sites/ folder, e.g., in the default website folder /sites/default/. A container page must be linked with a template JSP. If a container page is not linked with a template, it is incomplete, and an error is thrown by the servlet. The linking is done via the resource property named template that can be set via the Properties dialog. Normally, the template property is set at the root folder of a website and then inherited to each container page of a site.
